Submodules¶

cottontail.base module¶

class cottontail.base.CottontailBase(exchange_name='', hostname='localhost', port=5672, logger=<logging.Logger object at 0x105ba24d0>)[source]¶

Bases: object

A service base class for implementing messaging patterns using the RabbitMQ library. Supported patterns include pub/sub, RPC, topic subscription, and work queues.

Args:
exchange_name (str, optional): Name of the message exchange to create, defaults to ‘’. hostname (str, optional): Hostname for this pub/sub client, defaults to ‘localhost’. port (int, optional): Numeric port for this pub/sub client, defaults to ‘5672’. exchange_type (str, optional): Exchange type to create (‘headers’, ‘topic’, ‘direct’, ‘fanout’), defaults to ‘direct’. confirm_delivery (bool, optional): Whether to request ‘ack’ messages from consumers, default is True. logger (module, optional): The logging module to use with this Client instance, default is ‘utils.logger’.
Attributes:
logger (module): The logging module to use with this Client instance. exchange_name (string): Exchange name to create, default ‘’, the default exchange. exchange_type (string): Exchange type to create (‘headers’, ‘topic’, ‘direct’, or ‘fanout’), default ‘direct’. exchange (tuple): The exchange name and type represented as a tuple.
Raises:
CottontailError: If exchange_type is not in the valid EXCHANGE_TYPES.
acknowledge(message_receipt)[source]¶

Acknowledge the message delivery from RabbitMQ by sending a Basic.Ack RPC method for the delivery tag.

Args:
message_receipt (int): The delivery tag from the Basic.Deliver frame
close_connection()[source]¶

Closes the connection to RabbitMQ

Returns:
bool: True if successful
declare_queue(name, durable=True, exclusive=False)[source]¶
Args:

name (string): Name of the queue to declare

durable (bool, optional): Survive reboots of the broker, defaults to True so we can increase reliability. exclusive (bool, optional): Only allow access by the current connection, defaults to True.

Returns:
basestring: The name of the successfully declared queue
delete_queue(name)[source]¶
Args:
name (string): Name of the queue to delete if_unused (bool, optional): only delete if it’s unused if_empty (bool, optional): only delete if the queue is empty nowait (bool, optional): Do not wait for a Queue.DeleteOk
Raises:
TypeError: If ‘name’ is not a string
exchange_type = u'direct'¶
listen()[source]¶

Listen continuously on the subscriber socket for incoming messages.

publish(topic, content)[source]¶

Publish a message with a specified topic to the exchange

Args:
topic (str): The topic of the message, to be read by subscribers of that topic. content (str): The contents of the message to be sent
Raises:
TypeError: If ‘content’ is not a string
subscribe(queue_name=None, topic=None, acknowledge=True, exclusive=False)[source]¶

Subscribe to the messages of a particular queue

Args:
queue_name (basestring, optional): The name of the queue to subscribe to, defaults to None. topic (basestring, optional): The topic or key to filter messages by, defaults to None. acknowledge (bool, optional): Whether to send an ‘ack’ message back to the producer upon message receipt, default is True.
Returns:
bool: True if successful
Raises:
CottontailError: If a subscription is issued to the default (‘’) exchange. See http://docs.oasis-open.org/amqp/core/v1.0/amqp-core-complete-v1.0.pdf for details.

cottontail.errors module¶

Cottontial Error classes and functions.

exception cottontail.errors.CottontailBaseError[source]¶

Bases: exceptions.Exception

Base exception class for Cottontail errors in Python.

exception cottontail.errors.CottontailError(message, code)[source]¶

Bases: cottontail.errors.CottontailBaseError

A generic error for the Cottontail client

Args:
message (str): Name of the error message to pass code (int): Numeric code of the error to display

class cottontail.pubsub.Publisher(exchange_name='', hostname='localhost', port=5672, logger=<logging.Logger object at 0x105ba24d0>)[source]¶

Bases: cottontail.pubsub.PubSubBase

A server class for publishing messages in a pub/sub pattern.

Overwritten methods:
_bind_to_queue: Not necessary for a queue publisher, only a subscriber
